intro: Schistocarpha hondurensis, commonly known as the Honduras thistle, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a compact, bushy appearance. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellowish. Schistocarpha hondurensis is often found in open woodlands and along rocky slopes in its native range.
